title: Disappearing images in e-learning courses
content: I created an e-learning course and published it to web. On several slides in this course in Firefox browser (91.0.2 v.) some pictures disappear and appear randomly after some time (for example 30s). These errors do not occur in Chromium based browsers - like Microsoft Edge. These images disappear/appear when the window of Firefox is rescaling too. The problem has been reported to authoring tool support and has been confirmed by them. Any suggestions from Firefox browser users?

title: Firefox won't load sites after change in redirection (loads fine in other browsers)
content:
Hi--

I recently changed redirection for several of my domains (e.g. 695minnesota.com and dopesession.com)--previously, the redirection was handled by my DNS provider (DNS Made Easy), but I recently changed it to happen at the registrar level (Namesilo). It's been 72 hours since the change, but FF will not load the sites at all. Here's what I've done:

  • Flushed local DNS cache (in windows, ipconfig/flushdns).
  • Cleared browser cache
  • requested Cloudflare (what my routers and PCs use for DNS) to purge the cache for these 2 sites
  • set proxy to "none" in FF settings
  • disabled DNS over HTTPS

Using IE and Edge, the sites redirect to the correct sites just fine. But FF refuses to load anything at all--I've tried various computers (and my iphone running FF) on various networks, no luck. Using the network inspector, I sometimes get a ns_binding_aborted error (on Windows). FF on iOS gives me a request timed out (NSURLErrorDomain).

I'm running FF 92.0 x64 on Win 10 x64.

Any ideas what is going on here?

Thanks! Sandheep
creator: firefox1533

title: Redirect loop
content:
Good morning. I have been using Firefox for a long time, but yesterday this message appeared:

Redirect loop

Firefox has detected that the server is redirecting the request for this resource in such a way that it cannot be completed. 

    This problem may occur as a result of blocking or rejecting cookies.

It appears only when I want to enter the name of the item on the field auction in Poland: https://allegro.pl/

There was never such a problem before. I can use this page, but I cannot enter any data. I sell a lot through it and I need it very much. I have cleared cookies for this site. It didn't do anything. The page opens normally on the other browser I used to check. I don't know what I can do to fix the problem. Please help.

PS. I attach a photo of the error. The inscriptions are in my language, i.e. in Polish.

title: Junk Mail on Firefox
content:
Since the beginning of the year, mail from people who are sharing political ideas have found a way to get their e-mails placed on my Firefox mailbox. Most of what they are selling is hearsay. How do I teach Firefox to exclude these unwanted pieces of 'garbage'? For example: UAF Report, Red Right Daily, Zero Hour Patriots, The Patriot Chronicles, Steadfast and Loyal, are, at the moment, the one ones that I am now finding in my Firefox mail box every day. I would like for Firefox to stop allowing them to find their way into my mail box!

I would suspect that in the future, this problem of 'unwanted e-mails' is going to get worse. Does Mozilla Support have a solution for this problem?

title: Lost theme when a new device syncs
content:
A few hours ago I installed firefox on an old laptop, logged in, synced my bookmarks etc. Everything went fine except for that this laptop was having the default dark theme and it synced this theme with my main laptop. Now I can't find the theme that my main laptop was using.

I've tried: - Searching for it in about:addons - Searching for it in https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/themes/ in my personal profile

How do I find the theme I was using for my main laptop again? it was a default firefox theme which had purple/orange as the main colors.
creator: agic.determined

title: Can't uninstall or reinstall Firefox.  Tried EVERY suggestion and route.  Edge works, but I want Firefox.  It's there on the desktop, but it won't open.  We already got a suggestion
content:
WE TRIED ALL THIS STUFF BELOW: "You can check for issues caused by a corrupted or incomplete Visual C++ installation that is missing runtime components (Redistributable Packages) required by Firefox, especially VCRUNTIME140_1.dll.

See "Visual Studio 2015, 2017 and 2019":

https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/2977003/the-latest-supported-visual-c-downloads https://aka.ms/vs/16/release/vc_redist.x64.exe https://aka.ms/vs/16/release/vc_redist.x86.exe You may not need the latter (32-bit version) if you use 64-bit Firefox. You may have to reboot the computer.

On computer startup, there's a message like the one above Tthat pops up, but related to itunes: "...especially VCRUNTIME140_1.dll."

Several hours wasted already trying to fix this over two weeks. It finally worked okay the first time, but then I X'd out a couple of small boxes that popped up on the desktop on the next startup without paying attention to what they said. Back to being messed up. My bad.
creator: rpa2998

title: address bar recommending nonsense url repeatedly
content:
Every couple of days, I go to check what the covid updates are in my province by going to covid19stats.alberta.ca/

However, if I click in the address bar and start typing "cov" - firefox continually recommends covid19stats.aberta.ca/ (with alberta misspelled)

I'm sure I never typed out this url and gone there, and I've deleted it from the search suggestions a half-dozen times. This doesn't happen for me in other browsers.

There is nothing meaningful at "aberta.ca" and I've been to the "alberta.ca" one hundreds of times by now so you'd think it would recommend sites I go to a lot.

Why does it keep suggesting this nonsense url?
